data.title: must get the poutine!
data.text: This was right next to the hotel so I decided to stop in after seeing poutine on the menu. The food was amazing. If you are a drinker, the menu must have had something for everyone - there was one page of food choices and like 6 for drinks! The atmosphere was great - the bartenders were cool to watch. If you're short, ask for a table - everything I saw had high tables and my feet didn't reach even the bars on the bottom of the seats (I'm 5'3").

data.title: Awesome Little bar downtown
data.text: Loved this bar downtown that also serves small plates as well. Very unique cocktails are made here!! Ambiance is fantastic and the staff is a lot of fun!! Would definitely stop by and try this place out!!

owner_response.author: SURG_RestaurantGroup, Guest Relations Manager at Distil, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks so much for the great review!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: REally the BEST service in town..... and cocktails
data.text: From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with friendly and helpful staff. Not only that, but the service and cocktails were WAY above average. We traveled from Denver, and we were just shocked at how nice and welcoming everyone in this bar was! No one was pretentious or acted like we were lucky to be there. We most highly recommend this place. I cant say enough about Bill the manager or the friendly and talkative Bartenders! Thanks NIC and Bill for making us feel welcome and at home.

owner_response.author: SURG_RestaurantGroup, Guest Relations Manager at Distil, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for stopping in! We're so glad you had a great time with us and hope the rest of your trip was just as fun. Stop in and see us when you're in town again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great ears
data.text: Great food and service. Downtown dining week and it was all delicious steak cooked to perfection as well as mushroom  pappardelle. Service drinks and dessert perfect.

owner_response.author: SURG_RestaurantGroup, Guest Relations Manager at Distil, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for the feedback! We hope you come visit us again soon to try our other menu items.

-SURG
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Top spot in Downtown Milwaukee
data.text:
Went here primarily due to location near Marriott Downtown & rainy weather.  We were not disappointed.  We came for late night drinks and bit of food.  Used opentable for 9pm reservations, though probably would have not needed if just sat at the bar.  Either way, glad we did as the booth was very intimate and our waitress was very attentive.  

Drinks were on point.  Bourbon sour was special.  We got the meat/cheese platter.  Real honey came with it, and the waitress brought us an extra helping of the bread when we finished ours too quickly.  

The interior was very well done.  Turned a high ceiling location and made it feel "smaller" in a good way.  Only gripe was that there seemed to be some over serving going on, as there were at least 2-3 people blitzed.  Not something I would ever truly complain about in a bar setting, but Distil seemed to try to create a more sophisticated vibe that didn't jibe with that nonsense.  Either way, the complaint is rather petty and would not keep me from returning.

owner_response.author: SURG_RestaurantGroup, Guest Relations Manager at Distil, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback! Sorry about the rowdy crowd, but so glad to hear you still enjoyed yourselves. Hope we see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fantastic drinks, food and service
data.text: Unbelievable selection of spirits. Highly recommend sharing plates as a group and their specialty cocktails. The service was great! Thanks for a great night Distil

owner_response.author: SURG_RestaurantGroup, Guest Relations Manager at Distil, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the review Chris! We hope to see you back in soon to try our new menu!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Unique Bar Offerings!
data.text: We stopped in here for a drink quick before our dinner reservations at Carnevor. Really enjoyed the décor and atmosphere, and had a very attentive and knowledgeable bartender. Unique drink menu made for a great experience. Will happily stop again!

owner_response.author: SURG_RestaurantGroup, Guest Relations Manager at Distil, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your review! So happy to hear you had a great time with us. 

See you soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: You’re DISTIL the One
data.text:
Mixology is all the rage these days.  And more and more bars, restaurants and such are jumping on the bandwagon.  Even if it is delivering on a classic cocktail like an Old Fashioned or deconstructing it, craft cocktails are as hot as craft beers and spirits.  And Distil is right in the thick of things.

And they do it very well.

We hit Distil right when they opened at 5pm on a Saturday as we had sporting event to attend at 7pm.  So, we were the first, and only customer, for a bit.  I will say, by the time we left around 645pm, it had filled up nicely.  

Walking in, you are greeted with a long, but narrow look and feel.  Not cramped, just a long look down the very cool bar.  Adorned with many bottles of spirits.  Don’t even bother trying to “see what they have.”  The look and feel overall is great.  Especially the ceiling.  Service from the start was great.  The bartenders a sharp look with the vest, slightly rolled sleeves and tie.  Proper but not pretentious.  

The server was most helpful in describing the cocktails.  They also have a nice selection of beers.  Very few wine choices.

We had four of their signature cocktails.  All of them very well executed and unique.  From the Bourbon Sour to the Rosa Umada, Golden Rivalry and Pele’s Antidote.  I would try any of those again and then some of the 10 or so other options.  We initially selected three and asked our server to bring his and the bartenders favorite two.  It made it a bit more fun.  While I am sure you can get a rum and coke, save that for the corner tavern.  Though I am sure their take on a rum and coke would be exceptional!!!

And just as the cocktails were well prepared and presented, so was the food.   Plates, for the most part, are small enough for sharing.  So we had the cauliflower, cheese curds, chickpea fries and mushroom crostini.  Each came out as it was ready, which is what we requested.  Fresh flavors, great presentation, balance of taste and texture and smell.  Enticed all senses.  

I would go back.  Sometimes a place like Distil might deliver on cocktails and come up short on food.  Or they may excel at food and come up short on their “boutique” cocktails.  In this case, they deliver on both.

Cheers to Distil.

owner_response.author: SURG_RestaurantGroup, Guest Relations Manager at Distil, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you SO much for taking the time to write this review! We are so happy you enjoyed yourselves and hope you visit again soon. 

Best Regards,

SURG Restaurant Group
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great cocktails and bourbon
data.text: Stopped by for after dinner cocktail wait staff was great ,friendly and engaging. Great bourbon sidecar and a long list of bourbon choices. Will definitely stop again.

data.title: Neat Place, ok drinks
data.text: Very nice inside!  Dimply lit and decorated very nice.  However, drinks are pricey, and just average.  Servers, while fine, were a bit cold.  OK place to grab a drink, but be prepared to pay a bit.

data.title: Mad Scientist Cocktails, Apps
data.text:
So, the process and care that goes into crafting a cocktail here is pretty epic. I saw my glass being "smoked", lemon peel was bring squeezed on top for a dash of lemon oil...other things happening which were beyond my scope. 

Bottom line, best whiskey drink I have had. My friend and I sat at the bar and the fellas working it were very laid back and easy to converse with. I had the bartender/mad scientist make me a whiskey drink, his favorite, and I ended up with a whiskey drink, my favorite. Only problem is I would have to hop on a plane to Milwaukee to get this expertly crafted cocktail again. We ended up eating food there, and the menu is limited for dinner dinner. A super rich and tasty burger was the only full meal option, but it was very good. We also split some cheese curds with ranch and I was really loving life. 

This place is near the Marriott downtown in Milwaukee and would be a great stop off for a business traveler's nightcap or vacationers treat of apps and drinks. If I lived in Milwaukee I would probably try and make it into town once a month for a special night out. Not super expensive, drinks around $10 and burger was $12 I think. Definitely a good place for friends and couples to get together, visit and try new drinks.

owner_response.author: SURG_RestaurantGroup, Manager at Distil, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback, Ryan! We hope you come visit us again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great place for a cocktail
data.text:
This place was just a couple doors down from our hotel (Hotel Metro) and we just wanted a snack and a drink, so we walked down. First impression was great - lovely decor, with lots of wood and copper ceiling. My kind of atmosphere, dim but not dark, classy but still comfortable and not uptight. I would feel comfortable here whether dressed up for a night out or in jeans. Great place for a cocktail and conversation. There were a decent amount of people sitting at the bar, around 8pm, but we opted for one of the high backed booths. 

To start, we ordered cheese curds and a couple beers. Beer list isn't huge but what they have is very good - seems very well curated, and dominated by Wisconsin brewed beer although they also had other crafts and imports. The cheese curds were fabulous and hit the spot. We decided to linger so we ordered another drink. They had a good selection of scotch and whiskey which made my husband very happy, and I had a hard time choosing from their cocktail menu. Nothing basic or using pre-made mixers here! These are cocktails the old fashioned way, complex and well balanced. I ordered a Bourbon Sour (from their menu - Elijah Craig 12Yr Bourbon, Lemon, Turbinado Sugar, Egg White, Bittercube Cherry Bark Vanilla Bitters, Angostura Bitters) and it was amazing (see attached photo) Our server was great, attentive without overdoing it and very friendly, though he told us he couldn't really help us with any questions on drinks, because he was underage, but that the bartender would be happy to come over if we needed him for anything. We would have stayed longer but we were already pretty wiped out so we didn't stick around. Not a huge food menu, but what they had looked great. If we hadn't already eaten dinner I would have loved to have tried more of it. Next time we are in town I would love to come back! If I lived in the area I could see this place being somewhere I would go to often.

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text: It wasn't busy for a Saturday night and we came across this place by chance on a weekend away. Beautiful building and decor. Loved the Last Train to Fremont drink especially if you like something on the sweeter side. Sat in the high top tables and waiter was very knowledge about drinks. Wish we had stayed here for more than one. We will be back!

data.title: Be "Distil" my beating heart.......
data.text:
Tonight my wife accompanied me to dinner tonight (Aug. 20, 2015) as I was meeting a former work colleague for dinner at Distil.  Distil is located at 722 N. Milwaukee Street, in downtown Milwaukee.  The street is like a "restaurant row" of sorts, and it was a bit difficult to locate the restaurant, as it was wedged between other restaurants and not clearly marked.  Nor was the building address visible to the casual passerby.  I believe Distil has valet parking, unless the parking guys were with other restaurants on the block.  

Distil's interior was rather dark.  Very dark grained wood and a copper ceiling with baroque style crown moulding also in copper.  The restaurant is very long and narrow.  Estimated about 50 feet deep and under 20 feet wide.  The bar looked like it could seat 12 patrons.  There were high backed booths for 2 along one length of the wall, and seating for under 20 diners in the back of the house.  Our table was in the front of the house, which was very dark.  No window in that area, and the only window was in the main door.  The tables were elevated and the chairs were more like high bar stool type seating.  I found the seating a bit uncomfortable and just let my legs hang under the table.  We were greeted by our server, Kameron, who indicated he was a relatively new hire and not as familiar with the menu as a result.  He also could not provide much assistance where spirits and libations were concerned due to his not being 21 and couldn't sample them.  He did bring a bartender over to describe the drinks.  

My wife and I have patronized several restaurants in the SURG group and selected Distil because of our familiarity with the head chef there, Joe McCormick, who we have known since he was 5 years old.  Upon our arrival, we learned that Joe and the former pastry chef at Distil were in the Muskego area opening a new restaurant.  Obviously, the Distil web site needs severe updating, as it listed both Joe and the pastry chef as still working at Distil.  

My former co-worker ordered a "Rotating Old Fashioned" from the drink menu and liked it so much she ordered a second.  My wife drank a glass of house Riesling, and I ordered a Pabst Blue Ribbon beer, just to relive a few minutes of my college days back at WSU-Oshkosh in 1966.  Drinks were served without delay, as there were only around 6 other patrons in the restaurant at the 5:30pm time we arrived.  Distil's menu is more on the order of tapas, which I am not a fan of, as I like to eat, and eat mass quantities.  

Our dinner order consisted of a number of Distil's offerings:  1) Cheese curds, consisting of Clock Shadow cheddar cheese curds, beer battered, and served with buttermilk ranch dressing.  A few of the cheese curds were overdone and crunched a bit more than they should have.  The order size was ample for 3 people, as each of us got 3 curds or so.  2) Bistecca Pizzaiola, consisting of tenderloin tips, hot Cappicola, and Pomadoro sauce.  For the uninitiated, almost everything from a pig can more or less be bacon.  Cappicola comes from the neck muscles to the 4th or 5th rib of the pig's shoulder.  It is often dry cured and used like a sandwich meat.  For our Bistecca, it was cooked and tasted a bit like bacon, without the intense salt rush one can get from bacon.  The steak serving was around 8-9 pieces, which would have made a better appetizer than a main dish.  But, the steak was good.  3) Smelt, which I ate alone.  Smelt are a family of small fish that often end up being eaten by larger fish.  They are caught by hand-netting them during their spawning runs.  They are headed and gutted, and often dipped in corn meal, and fried.  Such was the case at Distil.  I received a portion of around 20 smelt, which looked almost like an order of french fries.  They were served with tartar sauce and baked lemon.  I eat most foods plain, and did not use anything on the smelt.  A couple of them tasted "fishy", but they were good.  4)  Moroccan Cauliflower, consisting of cauliflower, parmesan batter, preserved lemon, and harissa.  The cauliflower was enjoyed by all and the parmesan batter was interesting, to say the least.  The dish was good.  5) Mushroom Crostini, consisting of shiitake, Crimini, and portobello mushrooms and tellegio on a toasted baguette.  The serving was 3 long pieces of baguette with mushrooms atop.  Personally, I find mushrooms to be one of the world's most disgusting food items and I'd rather starve than eat them.  The ladies at them and enjoyed the dish.  Last up was 6) Fresca Salad, consisting of mixed greens, fresh berries (strawberries, raspberries, and blueberries), goat cheese, candied walnuts, and poppy seed dressing.  Once again, the ladies shared the salad and thought it was a very inspired creation.  The amount of food we ordered would have likely been adequate for 2 people instead of the 3 of us, as all 3 of us like to eat.  

With dinner not really being enough, we elected to sample both of Distil's dessert options: 1) Rocky Road, consisting of walnut sponge cake, chocolate mousse, toasted marshmallows (which looked like whipped cream), chocolate covered pretzels, and marshmallow ice cream.  This was somewhat of a hodgepodge of ingredients that worked quite well together.  The chocolate covered pretzels were coarsely ground and spread on the plate near the ice cream and the marshmallow cream.  I wasn't sure what to make of the walnut sponge cake, as the chocolate mousse was mixed into the cake.  2) Belgian Waffle, consisting of a half of a Belgian waffle, fresh strawberries (which I ordered on the side.....I like fruit about as much as I like mushrooms), strawberry jam, opalys crisp (a version of French chocolate), and vanilla ice cream.  We found the waffle a bit overcooked and had to be careful when cutting it with a fork so that the piece wasn't launched across the room.  This dessert wasn't as intricate as the Rocky Road, but it was OK.  

Dinner, dessert, and drinks came to about $111.00 for the three of us, which was a bit pricey, but there was a fair amount of food for the money.  Kameron's service was good.  He paced the meal well, despite his newness to the facility and the menu.

PROS: great food at decent prices for the "tapas" crowd; classy interior/ambience; intimate setting; food prepared quickly

CONS: server was new and will only get better with time; music was a bit loud and conversations were hard to hear; lighting was subdued and made it difficult to read the menu; the craft cocktails' names were too long and too complicated of an ingredient list to deal with; web site needed updating, as neither chef listed on the site works in the restaurant.  

On the whole, however, one can't go wrong with the SURG group of restaurants.  We like them and you probably would too.

data.title: Excellent Meal and Superb Cocktails
data.text: We went to Distil for first time during Milwaukee's Downtown Dining Week.  What a find!  We'll definitely be back.  This is a beautiful restaurant/bar - like the vibe there.  Both our food and waitress were outstanding.  We both had the Classic Old-Fashioned - very good.

data.title: Classic cocktails
data.text: We had four cocktails here. An old fashioned, gin and tonic, Hemingway daiquiri, and  the sparkling. The sparking had cava with juice and rum and a fruit peel. It was fantastic. The Hemingway daiquiri was simply lime juice, rum, and luxardo. Everything tastes good with luxardo. For the gin and tonic they had several assortments of gin and I tried one I am not familiar with and was not disappointed. Also loved the copper ceiling, brick walls, and wood accents.

data.title: Delicious hamburger
data.text: Went in on Saturday night around 10:30 pm as they do serve until 11:00 pm. Walking in and there was no hostess, everybody looking busy. Finally a bartender came over to give get us a seat. Waitress seemed new or uneducated on the menu. Bartender very informative and knew his drinks and everything about the menu. Smaller menu but partners with Surg restaurant group so you can order for their partner restaurants, umami Moto and carnevour.  The hamburger was delicious. Would go back again just got the burger and cheese curds.

data.title: Perfect Pick-Me-Up for tired travelers
data.text: This eatery was near our hotel and after travel we needed a good stiff drink and supper/snacks before retiring. This was the right place. The mixologist here is excellent and we enjoyed the cocktails we ordered. Before retiring we ordered the local cheese tray along with sliced salamis that were from San Francisco. A shout out to our stellar waitress too.

data.title: Great Experience
data.text:
We had dinner here on a Friday evening.  The only downside was difficulty finding the place (their door is barely marked).

I enjoyed their cocktail menu, which featured drinks I like but often have to special order.  They did a magnificent job with the my sazerac.  Beer and wine selection was respectable.

Much of the menu is tapas.  We ordered six tapas plates between the four of us.  Highlights were the pork belly, bourbon ribs, and the flat breads, all of which were fantastic.

data.title: Great Place For Before or After Dinner
data.text:
Although Distl serves great food, the menu isn't extensive. It is at its best as a high end bar before or after dinner. If you are still hungry after dinner or just can't wait for dinner, stop at Distil.

The drink list is the best of the city. Milwaukee is a drinking town best known for beer. Distil, however, has the most extensive liquor collection in the area. Chances are if you want it, they have it.

The bar tenders are all very knowledgable and friendly. First time visitors will feel right at home and not feel like an outsider. As part of the SURG restaurant group, it has to live up to some very high standards and certainly does.
